result.execSummary:
The defendant Bobbie Lee Brazil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any sentence.  Release for inmate work assignments only.  Court notes a strong objectin to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent.  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

No alcohol.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid perscription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firerm magazine or any body armor.
Participate in alcohol and drug asessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain abolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharge by 6/1/2016.  Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bobbie Lee Brazil

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Count one.  PER CLERK, clarification from DCC, sentence date on BOTH counts one and two  is 5/27/15.

Defendant Bobbie Lee Brazil in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Sentencing continued. Court continues Sentencing from 05-06-2015: 

AS TO COUNT 1: (placed on the record on 05-06-2015)

AS TO COUNT 2: 
Court ordered defendant to serve 4 days in the House of Correction, with 4 days (2-11-2015 to 2-14-2015) credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 06-01-2016. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;

Defendant Bobbie Lee Brazil in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court ordered defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for inmate work assignments ONLY; credit for 4 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 9 MONTHS with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 


Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

AS TO THE ORAL AMENDED COUNT 1 AND 2  - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Case adjourned for sentencing, Branch 17.

Defendant Bobbie Lee Brazil in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
As to the State's oral motion, defendant is charged as follows: 
AS TO COUNT 1: Court ordered charge amended to Possession of cocaine, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 961.41(3g)(c), a Misdemeanor.
AS TO COUNT 2: Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, contrary to Wisconsin Statues section 961.573(1), a Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Bobbie Lee Brazil in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea and Sentencing.  Court orders case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 4-23-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of PRELIMINARY HEARING transcript commencing FEBRUARY 25, 2015,  received and filed. (22 Pages)  Copy of transcript forwarded to:  WISCONSIN STATE PUBLIC DEFENDER, ATTORNEY VALERIA L. TAYLOR, 819 N. 6TH STREET, 9TH FLOOR, MILWAUKEE, WI  53203.  jm

Defendant Bobbie Lee Brazil in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Brandon Wigley for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For the reasons placed on the record the case is adjourned for Status Conference on 4-3-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Status conference scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bobbie Lee Brazil in court with attorney Alexis Liggins for Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Michael White, student intern under the supervision of Hanna Kolberg for Paul Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Ryan DeWitt-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 02-25-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Bobbie Lee Brazil
Current: 2923 West Walnut Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 02-17-2015)
Prior: 2923 West Walnut Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208

As an additional condition of bail:
No drugs without a valid prescription

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bobbie Lee Brazil in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Christopher J. Ladwig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-032

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
Clerk:  jms
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/17/15 @ 1:30 pm
